items.title: Document title
items.help_text: The title of the metadata document (which will usually be the same as the element "Title" in the "Video description / Title statement" section). The metadata document is the metadata file (XML or JSON file) that is being generated.

items.title: Document ID
items.help_text: A unique identifier for the video's metadata document. This identifier must be unique in the catalog where the metadata are intended to be published. Ideally, the identifier should also be unique globally. This is different from the "Primary ID" in section "Table description / Title statement", although it is good practice to generate identifiers that establish a clear connection between these two identifiers. The Document ID could also include the metadata document version identifier. For example, if the "Primary ID" of the video is “VDO_0001”, the Document ID could be “IHSN_VDO_001_v1.0” if the metadata are produced by the IHSN and if this is version 1.0 of the metadata. Each organization should establish systematic rules to generate such IDs. A validation rule can be set (using a regular expression) in user templates to enforce a specific ID format.

items.title: Metadata producers

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the person or organization who produced the metadata or contributed to its production.

props.title: Abbrevation
props.help_text: The abbreviation (or acronym) of the organization that is referenced in "Name".

props.title: Affiliation
props.help_text: The affiliation of the person or organization mentioned in "Name".

props.title: Role
props.help_text: The specific role of the person or organization mentioned in "Name" in the production of the metadata.

items.help_text: The metadata producer is the person or organization with the financial and/or administrative responsibility for the processes whereby the metadata document was created. This is a "Recommended" element. For catalog administration purposes, information on the producer and on the date of metadata production is useful.

items.title: Production date
items.help_text: The date the metadata on this video was produced (not distributed or archived), preferably entered in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD or YYY-MM). A validation rule can be set in user templates to enforce a date format. This is a "Recommended" element, as information on the producer and on the date of metadata production is useful for catalog administration purposes.

items.title: Version
items.help_text: The version of the metadata document (not the version of the video itself).

items.title: Primary ID
items.help_text: "Primary ID" is a unique identification number that is used to uniquely identify a video in a catalog. It will also help users cite the video properly. The best option is to obtain a Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the video, as it will ensure that the ID is unique globally. Alternatively, it can be an identifier constructed by an organization using a consistent scheme. Note that the schema allows you to provide more than one identifier for a video (see identifiers below).

items.title: Title
items.help_text: The title of the video.

items.title: Other identifiers
items.help_text: This repeatable element is used to enter identifiers (IDs) other than the "Primary ID" (IDNO). It can for example be a Digital Object Identifier (DOI). The "Primary ID" can be repeated here (the "Primary ID" does not provide a "Type" parameter, so if a DOI or other standard ID type is used as main identifier, it is recommended to repeat it here with the identification of the type).

props.title: Type
props.help_text: The type of identifier. This could be for example “DOI”.

props.title: Identifier
props.help_text: The identifier itself.

items.title: Alternate title
items.help_text: An alternate video title (other than the one entered in "Title"), possibly an abbreviated version.

items.title: Creator
items.help_text: Organization or person who created/authored the video.

items.title: Production company
items.help_text: The production company or studio responsible for the item.

items.title: Recorded at
items.help_text: This element identifies the event where the video was recorded (e.g., a conference, or a demonstration).

items.title: Publisher
items.help_text: The name of the publisher of the video.

items.title: Translators
items.help_text: Organization or person who adapted the video to different languages. This element maps to the element translator in VideoObject.

props.title: First name
props.help_text: The first name of the translator.

props.title: Initial
props.help_text: The initials of the translator.

props.title: Last name
props.help_text: The last name of the translator.

props.title: Affiliation
props.help_text: The affiliation of the translator.

items.title: Sponsors
items.help_text: This element is used to list the funders/sponsors of the video. If different funding agencies financed different stages of the production process, use the “role” attribute to distinguish them.

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the sponsor (person or organization).

props.title: Abbreviation
props.help_text: The abbreviation (acronym) of the sponsor.

props.title: Grant
props.help_text: The grant (or contract) number.

props.title: Role
props.help_text: The specific role of the sponsor.

items.title: Other contributors
items.help_text:
Identifies the person(s) and/or organization(s) who contributed to the production of the video. The role attribute allows defining what the specific contribution of the identified person or organization was.

- Name: 
- Affiliation: 
- Abbreviation: 
- Role: 
- URL:

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the contributor (person or organization)

props.title: Affiliation
props.help_text: The affiliation of the contributor.

props.title: Abbreviation
props.help_text: The abbreviation for the institution which has been listed as the affiliation of the contributor.

props.title: Role
props.help_text: The specific role of the contributor. This could for example be “Cameraman”, “Sound engineer”, etc.

props.title: URI
props.help_text: A URI (link to a website, or email address) for the contributor.

items.title: Credits
items.help_text: This element can be used to credit the person(s) and/or organization(s) associated with a published video.

items.title: Contacts
items.help_text: Users of the video may need further clarification and information. This section may include the name-affiliation-email-URI of one or multiple contact persons. This block of elements will identify contact persons who can be used as resource persons regarding problems or questions raised by the user community.

props.title: Name
props.help_text: Name of a person or unit (such as a data help desk). It will usually be better to provide a title/function than the actual name of the person. Keep in mind that people do not stay forever in their position.

props.title: Role
props.help_text: The specific role of the person or organization mentioned in "Name", in regards to supporting users. This element is used when multiple names are provided, to help users identify the most appropriate person or unit to contact.

props.title: Affiliation
props.help_text: Affiliation of the person/unit.

props.title: Email
props.help_text: E-mail address of the person.

props.title: Telephone
props.help_text: A phone number that can be called to obtain information or provide feedback on the table. This should not be a personal phone number; a corporate number (typically of a data help desk) should be provided.

props.title: URL
props.help_text: A link to a website where contact information for name can be found.

items.title: Date created
items.help_text: The date the video was created. It is recommended to enter the date in the ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY). A validation rule can be set in user templates to enforce a date format. The date the video is created refers to the date that the video was produced and considered ready for dissemination.

items.title: Date published
items.help_text: The date the video was published. It is recommended to enter the date in the ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY). A validation rule can be set in user templates to enforce a date format.

items.title: Version
items.help_text: The version of the video refers to the published version of the video.

items.title: Status
items.help_text: The status of the video in terms of its stage in a lifecycle. A controlled vocabulary should be used. Example terms include {Incomplete, Draft, Published, Obsolete}. Some organizations define a set of terms for the stages of their publication lifecycle.

items.title: Description
items.help_text: A brief description of the video, typically about a paragraph long (around 150 to 250 words).

items.title: Genre
items.help_text: The genre of the video, broadcast channel or group. A controlled vocabulary can be used.

items.title: Audience
items.help_text: A brief description of the intended audience of the video, i.e. the group for whom it was created or for whom it may be suitable.

items.title: Keywords

props.title: Keyword
props.help_text: The keyword (or phrase) itself.

props.title: Vocabulary
props.help_text: The controlled vocabulary (including version number or date) from which the keyword is extracted, if any.

props.title: URL
props.help_text: The URL of the controlled vocabulary from which the keyword is extracted, if any.

items.help_text: Keywords are words or phrases that describe salient aspects of what the video is about. The addition of keywords can significantly improve the discoverability of data and is thus recommended. Keywords can summarize and improve the description of the content or subject matter of a resource. Keywords can be selected from a standard thesaurus, preferably an international, multilingual thesaurus. Or they can be suggested by machine learning models. A controlled vocabulary can be defined in user templates.

items.title: Topics

props.title: ID
props.help_text: The unique identifier of the topic. It can be a sequential number, or the ID of the topic in a controlled vocabulary.

props.title: Topic
props.help_text: The label of the topic.

props.title: Parent ID
props.help_text: When a hierarchical (nested) controlled vocabulary is used, the "Parent ID" field can be used to indicate a higher-level topic to which this topic belongs.

props.title: Vocabulary
props.help_text: The specification (name including the version and date) of the controlled vocabulary from which the topic is taken.

props.title: URL
props.help_text: A link (URL) to the controlled vocabulary website.

items.help_text: "Topics" indicate the broad substantive topic(s) that the video represents. A topic classification facilitates referencing and searches in electronic survey catalogs; topics should thus be selected from a standard controlled vocabulary, for example the CESSDA Topics classification (a typology of topics available in 11 languages), or the Journal of Economic Literature (JEL) Classification System. Note that you may combine topics from more than one controlled vocabulary.

items.title: Persons

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the person.

props.title: Role
props.help_text: The role in the video of the person mentioned in "Name".

items.help_text: A list of persons who appear in the video.

items.title: Main entity
items.help_text: Indicates the main entity described in the video, if any.

items.title: Transcript
items.help_text: The transcript of the video content, provided as a text. Adding the transcript in the metadata will make the video much more discoverable, as the content of the transcription can be indexed in catalogs. Note that if the text is very long, an alternative is to save it in a separate text file and to make it available in a data catalog as an external resource. The transcript can be entered in multiple languages. For the language codes and names, the use of the ISO 639-2 standard is recommended.

props.title: Language code
props.help_text: The code of the language of the transcript.

props.title: Language name
props.help_text: The name of the language of the transcript.

props.title: Text
props.help_text: The transcript itself, in the language mentioned in "Language name".

items.title: Album
items.help_text: When a video is published in a catalog containing many other videos, it may be desirable to organize them by album. Albums are collections of videos organized by theme, period, location, or other criteria. One video can belong to more than one album. Albums are “virtual collections”.

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name (label) of the album.

props.title: Description
props.help_text: A brief description of the album.

props.title: Owner
props.help_text: The owner or custodian of the album.

props.title: URL
props.help_text: A link (URL) to the album.

items.title: Languages
items.help_text: The language refers to the language in which the video is published. Most videos will only be provided in one language. This is however a repeatable field, to allow for more than one language to be listed. For the language codes and names, the use of the ISO 639-2 standard is recommended.

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The name of the language.

props.title: Code
props.help_text: The code of the language.

items.title: Is based on
items.help_text: A resource from which this video is derived or from which it is a modification or adaption.

items.title: Is part of
items.help_text: Indicates another video that this video is part of.

items.title: Relations
items.help_text: Defines the relation between the video being documented and other resources.

items.title: Country

props.title: Name
props.help_text: The country/region name. The name and spelling of countries should be consistent across all resources being documented. Many organizations have their own policies on the naming of countries/regions/economies/territories, which data curators will have to comply with.

props.title: Code
props.help_text: The country/region code (entered as a string, even for numeric codes). It is recommended to use a standard list of countries and regions, such as the ISO country list (ISO 3166).

items.help_text: The list of countries (or regions) covered by the video, if applicable. This refers to the content of the video, not to the country where the video was released.

items.title: Spatial coverage
items.help_text: Indicates the place(s) which are depicted or described in the video. This element complements the "Country" element. It can be used to qualify the geographic coverage of the video, in the form of a free text.

items.title: Bounding box

props.title: West
props.help_text: West longitude of the bounding box.

props.title: East
props.help_text: East longitude of the bounding box.

props.title: South
props.help_text: South latitude of the bounding box.

props.title: North
props.help_text: North latitude of the bounding box.

items.help_text: This element is used to define one or multiple geographic bounding box(es), which are the rectangular fundamental geometric description of the geographic coverage of the video. A bounding box is defined by west and east longitudes and north and south latitudes, and includes the largest geographic extent of the video geographic coverage. The bounding box provides the geographic coordinates of the top left (north/west) and bottom-right (south/east) corners of a rectangular area. This element can be used in catalogs as the first pass of a coordinate-based search. The valid range of latitude in degrees is -90 and +90 for the southern and northern hemisphere, respectively. Longitude is in the range -180 and +180 specifying coordinates west and east of the Prime Meridian, respectively.

items.title: Reference time
items.help_text: The specific time described by the video, for works that emphasize a particular moment within an event.

items.title: Temporal coverage
items.help_text: Indicates the period that the video applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a Date/Time or as a textual string indicating a time period in ISO 8601 time interval format.

items.title: Video provider
items.help_text: The person or organization who provides the video.

items.title: Video URL
items.help_text: URL of the video.

items.title: Embed URL
items.help_text: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. For example, “https://www.youtube.com/embed/7Aif1xjstws”. To be embedded, a video must be hosted on a video sharing platform like Youtube (www.youtube.com). To obtain the “embed link” from Youtube, click on the “Share” button, then “Embed”. In the result box, select the content of the element "src =".

items.title: Repository
items.help_text: The name of the repository (organization).

items.title: Rights
items.help_text: A textual description of the rights associated to the video.

items.title: Copyright holder
items.help_text: The party holding the legal copyright to the video.

items.title: Copyright notice
items.help_text: Text of a notice appropriate for describing the copyright aspects of the video, ideally indicating the owner of the copyright.

items.title: Copyright year
items.help_text: The year during which the claimed copyright for the video was first asserted.

items.title: Citation
items.help_text: This element provides a required or recommended citation of the video file.

items.title: Media
items.help_text: A description of the media on which the recording is stored (other than the online file format); e.g., “DVD”.

items.title: Duration
items.help_text:
The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 format. ISO 8601 durations are expressed following the formatting instructions below, where (n) is replaced by the value for each of the date and time elements that follows the (n). For example: (3)H means 3 hours.
Instructions: Enter the duration as:  P(n)Y(n)M(n)DT(n)H(n)M(n)S where: 
- P is the Period designator and is always placed at the beginning of the duration
- (n)Y represents the number of years
- (n)M represents the number of months
- (n)W represents the number of weeks
- (n)D represents the number of days
- T is the Time designator and always precedes the time components
- (n)H represents the number of hours
- (n)M represents the number of minutes
- (n)S represents the number of seconds
For example, P1Y2M20DT3H30M8S represents a duration of one year, two months, twenty days, three hours, thirty minutes, and eight seconds.
Date and time elements including their designator may be omitted if their value is zero, and lower-order elements may also be omitted for reduced precision. For example, “P23DT23H” and “P4Y” are both acceptable duration representations.
As M can represent both Month and Minutes, the time designator T is used. For example, “P1M” is a one-month duration and “PT1M” is a one-minute duration.
Source: This information on the ISO 8601 was adapted from Wikipedia where more detailed information can be found.

items.title: Encoding format
items.help_text: The video file format, typically expressed using a MIME format.

items.title: Tags

props.title: Tag
props.help_text: A user-defined tag.

props.title: Tag group
props.help_text: A user-defined group (optional) to which the tag belongs. Grouping tags allows implementation of controlled facets in data catalogs.

items.help_text: Tags, especially when organized in tag groups, provide a powerful and flexible solution to enable custom facets (filters) in data catalogs.
